label: 136. Bond between James B. Heyward and William C. Heyward -- January 10, 1852
description: Bond for $11,200 between James B. Heyward and William C. Heyward.  Near copy of nos. 134 and 135.  2p. January 10, 1852.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: BOND-Sold by A. E. Miller.  State of South-Carolina.  KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, THAT I, James B. Heyward of Charleston and State aforesaid am held and firmly bound unto William C Heyward of St Bartholomews Parish and State aforesaid in the full and just sum of Eleven thousand, two hundred dollars to be paid unto the said William C Heyward his certain Attorney, Executors or Administrators, or Assigns: To which payment well and truly to be made and done I bind myself and each and every of my Heirs, Executors and Administrators, jointly and severally, firmly by these Presents. Sealed with my Seal and dated the tenth day of January in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and fifty two and in the Seventy Sixth year of the Independence of the United States of America. THE CONDITION of the above Obligation is such, That if the above bound James B. Heyward his Heirs, Executors, or Administrators, shall and do well and truly pay, or cause to be paid, unto the above-named William C Heyward his certain Attorney, Executors or Administrators, or Assigns, the full and just sum of Five thousand, Six hundred dollars with legal interest thereon, payable annually until the whole principal sum is paid on or before the tenth day of January which will be in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and fifty five without fraud or further delay, then the above Obligation to be void and of none effect, or else to remain in full force and virtue. SEALED AND DELIVERED IN THE PRESENCE OF Wm C Bee [End Page 1] Charleston 12th January 1853 Recd from Jas B Heyward Ex. by hand of Mr E Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dollars in full for one years interest on within Bond to 10 inst  Wm C Heyward Ex Wm Heyward Jr in Trust for Mrs S Heyward. Mr Wm C Bee & Co  $392.  Charleston 10 Jany. 1854 Recd from Jas B Heyward Esq by the hands of Mr E Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dolls in full for one years int on within Bond to date W C Heyward Ex Wm Heyward Jr Trust for Mrs S Heyward. Re W C Bee & Co  $392.  Charleston 12 Jany. 1855 Recd from J B Heyward Esq by the hands of Mr E Barnwell for Three hundred and ninety two Dolls in full for one years (page cut)  $392.-  Charleston 12 Jany. Inst Recd from Jas B Heyward Esqr by the hand of Ed Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dolls in full for one yrs int to 10 inst on within Bond W C Heyward Ex Wm Heyward in Trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward. W C Bee & Co  $392.-  Charleston 10 Jany 1857 Recd from Jas B Heyward by the hand of Ed Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dollars in full for one years interest to date on within Bond Wm C Heyward Ex. Wm Heyward in Trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward. Wm C Bee & Co  $392.  Charleston 19th Jan. 1858 Recd from Jas. B. Heyward by the hand of Ed. Barnwell Jr Three hundred and ninety two dollars in full for one years interest to 10th inst on within Bond Wm C. Heyward Ex Est Wm Heyward in trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward per Wm C. Bee & Co per T. S. Oxlade  $392  Charleston Jan. 14th 1859 Recd of Jas. B. Heyward by the hands of Edward Barnwell Jr. three hundred and ninety two dollars in full for one yrs int. to 10th inst. on within bond W C Heyward Ext. Est. Wm Heyward in trust for Mrs Sarah Heyward pr John S Bee for W C Bee & Co  Charleston 6 May 1859 Recd from Mr Jas B Heyward by the hands of E Barnwell Jr Two thousand eight hundred dolls on [?] principal of within Bond and also recd Six by three 16/100 Dolls in full for int on said payment to date W C Heyward Ex Est Wm Heyward in Trust pr WC Bee & Co  Charleston 10 Jany. 1860 Recd. of J B Heyward by the hand of W C Bee & Co Two thousand nine hundred & ninety six dolls in full of principal amt on within Bond W C Heyward Ex pr W C Bee & Co  [End Page 2]
